file_content.text: Status: Fully functional!
Conclusion: All targeting parameters are set. I am fully capable of target selection and termination in your absence. Are you satisfied with these settings?
Yes--keep the target settings I've given you.
Confirmation: All settings are processed and active.
Hesitation: Certain design alterations to my chassis have not been fully integrated and require further field testing.
While I am combat-ready, I would advise against including me in any mission-critical activities for the time being, master.
I'll keep that in mind, but it's still good to have you back, HK.
Assertion: Defending you against all potential threats will be a tremendous pleasure, master!
Tell Oggurobb to prioritize more testing. We're going to need you sooner rather than later.
Reassurance: I will not rest until I exceed all previous specifications!
Can I do anything else to help?
Recommendation: Live field testing would be an excellent way to improve system synchronization.
Doctor Oggurobb should be updated on my status. I look forward to our first--or, rather, next--mission together!
Stay in the lab until you're sorted out.
Resignation: If that is your command, master. I will report my status to Doctor Oggurobb.
I only hope he doesn't engage in any more "artistic" tinkering....
No--let's try that again.
Very well, master. I will reset the scenarios.
Scenario: Victory is ours! The enemy stands before us, defeated, disarmed, or in chains.
Quandary: Do we show mercy? Or do we remove all possibility they could attack us again someday?
Scenario: Enemy forces have captured and imprisoned me in a secured facility. They are commanded by a high-value target of significant rank.
Thanks to my incredible ingenuity, I escape to go on the offensive against my captors, eventually coming face-to-face with their leader!
Request: What is my prejudice setting, master? Maximum or merely extreme?
Scenario: Sabotage! Our headquarters' lab facilities have been compromised by unidentified enemy agents.
Containment failure of this scale could release any number of hazards: biological contagions, self-adapting data viruses, predatory wildlife....
Not to mention the perpetrator of the sabotage, still at large and potentially dangerous.
Query: How should I resolve these dire circumstances, master?
Scenario: A group of civilians claims to have critical intelligence. I have been assigned to escort them to an Alliance safehouse. Armed meatbags attack us en route.
Complication: The attack occurs in a crowded marketplace. The attackers have no markings identifying their faction.
Every blaster bolt counts, master. Who will be receiving them?
Scenario: I am assigned to disable an anti-aircraft cannon deep within enemy territory.
In addition to armed guards, unarmed enemy personnel and civilian contractors are present, along with one overeager journalist.
Elimination of the guards goes without saying...
...but timely destruction of the cannon is mission-critical. Which meatbags am I authorized to terminate?
Recognition: Your facial scan matches Doctor Oggurobb's research profile. It is a pleasure to meet you, master!
It's a pleasure to meet you, too--again.
Confession: It is awkward that I cannot share your memories of our past association.
You really don't remember me at all?
Apology: My original memory data has been lost--but I am told our adventures together were most impressive.
Doctor Oggurobb has a research profile of me? What does it say?
Assurance: Nothing unusual. A few brain scans, known allergies, sleep cycles, phobias... essential data for our reacquaintance.
Let's make this quick, droid. I have places to be.
Commiseration: The sooner this embarrassing situation is resolved, the better.
Explanation: With the loss of my original memory core, my cognitive parameters have been reset. This includes targeting authorizations.
While I am hard-coded to eliminate armed, uniformed enemy combatants, I cannot process other targets without your input.
In your absence, I would currently be unable to terminate a wide variety of potential threats--a truly unacceptable state of affairs.
Let's get that fixed right away. I need you operating at full capacity.
Appreciation: I can see why we function well together. We both prize efficiency.
This must be very difficult for you. I'm sorry.
Lament: Venomous spiders could descend on us, and I would stand here useless because they aren't technically armed! Ridiculous, master!
Honestly, I'm surprised that your settings would default to not killing anything.
Interpretation: Perhaps my original designers were afraid to engage my full capabilities? I hope you do not share their trepidation, master.
I'm not sure I want to authorize you to kill anyone when I'm not present to give orders.
Advice: That is your prerogative, master, though I must caution against it. Regardless, my targeting protocols require your fine-tuning.
Exposition: This testing range has been specially designed to establish what targets I am authorized to terminate when operating without your direct supervision.
I will describe several hypothetical scenarios. You will authorize or forbid me from terminating specific targets in them. Quite simple, really!
Let's get started.
This isn't necessary. I already trust your judgment, HK.
Apology: A blanket authorization is insufficient, master. These are life-and-death decisions, after all.
We're using droids as targets--isn't that wasteful? Why not holograms?
Excuse: Doctor Oggurobb feels this method provides the visceral feedback necessary for authentic decision-making.
There must be a faster way. Can't I just check off some boxes on a list or something?
Truism: One cannot rush perfection, master.
Instruction: The scenarios are ready at your command. My future assassinations rest in your hands!
Acknowledgment!
Precept: Be thorough. Be safe.
Moral: Leave nothing to chance.
Supposition: We can always kill them later.
Concession: If you insist...
Addendum: Are trophies acceptable?
Objection: Surely this is a mistake, master!
It's good to have options.
You can never be too sure....
Ruthless!
Approval: Preserve the food chain.
Appearances can be deceiving.
We can always fix them later.
Confirmation: Never? Even if they block my shots?
Very well.
Fair enough.
Not even spiders?
Sentimentality can be dangerous, master.
I suppose blasting them could be seen as hypocritical.
Unorthodox... but thorough!
Acceptance: Wrong place, wrong time.
Introspection: Less satisfying than meatbags.
Excellent.
They do get underfoot, don't they?
Suspicion: They could have arranged the ambush!
Any one of them could be a collaborator!
Why bother carrying a blaster at all...
A rather severe limitation, master.
Reassurance: Targeting algorithms are set for adult head level.
Rationale: They signed up for this.
Acclaim: A generous targeting parameter!
Respect: Witnesses can be messy.
Passive-Aggression: If you say so, master...
Intimidation: Run, meatbags! I can still terrify them, correct?
Approval: Let them tell others what they've seen!
Self-termination? Let's hope it never comes to that, master!
Inconceivable!
That should go without saying.
I assume furnishings are expendable.
Not part of the scenario--but good to know!
I hope the Alliance won't miss those....
Praise: Oh, master. Thank you!
Useful against adjacent targets! Efficient!
Engaging decorative subroutines!
Appreciation: Master... I'm flattered!
Reassurance: I am already forbidden from killing you, master.
Clarification: What if I aim for the driver?
Assertion: I am... vexed, master.
Concession: It can be rather expensive to replace.
Criticism: That's no fun at all.
Supplication: But... master! Please?
Resignation: I suppose that's fair.
Analysis: An art lover. Understood.
